page.title: 17BUCHLYVIE CHURCHES
page.content: {THE NORTH CHURCH,}formerly called the {'SEEDERS' CHURCH}stands in the old burial ground. It was built in {1752}by the congregation who carried the stone for the building by horse and cart from nearby quarries. It was closed for public worship in 1965 but is used on occasions for exhibitions. {THE SOUTH CHURCH AND MANSE,}Main Street was built in{1835.}It has, within the building, a vestry and kitchen area. The church bell is rung every Sunday before morning service, and once yearly to herald in the NEW YEAR. The church is linked with { {GARTMORE,}a nearby village, and the minister looks after both parishes, conducting two services every Sunday. During the week there are meetings of the Women's Guild and the Young Women's Group. Children attend Sunday School from October to June.
